parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Low level command to person to move to given position.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> person [[moveTo]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> person: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[PositionATL]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_myAgent [[moveTo]] [[getPosATL]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[doMove]], [[commandMove]], [[setDestination]], [[move]], [[moveToCompleted]], [[moveToFailed]], [[addWaypoint]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 14, 2010 - 05:44</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Rübe|Rübe]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
moveTo is a low-level command used in [[FSM]] called with doFSM or commandFSM. See [[doFSM]] for more information about this. Use [[doMove]] everywhere else - even in FSM executed with execFSM.
</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
